contentList.content: When the Great Sundering of Elves happened, The Eilistraean were forced to go with their Drow brethren, but went willingly. Ever hopeful one day they would be able to unite all Elves again. Despite their treatment they neither fully embracing the light or entirely shunning the dark, these Elves live somewhere inbetween trying to reconcile the rift between their cousins.
You were born and raised on the surface in a Eilistraean community or on the fringes of an Elvish community. Never fully trusted or included due to your parental heritage.

You were born and raised in the underdark in a Eilistraean community or on the fringes of an Drow community or possibly even born into a Lolth-Sworn community. Years of watching a different way of living was possible, you came to be part of the Eilistraeans.
Summon Moonfire, a small mote of light that can manipulate and interact with objects.
You enjoy a good adventure. Always ready to set foot out the door and investigate what that day will bring and where it will take you.
You are a loyal protector of your Kith and Kin. You will go to great lengths to see they are unharmed, even if they are the ones trying to harm you.
You love a good puzzle. Constantly looking for and into the various machinations the world has to offer to see how they work.

You enjoy a good adventure. Always ready to set foot out the door and investigate what that day will bring and where it will take you. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Investigation">Investigation</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Survival">Survival</LSTag>.

You are a loyal protector of your Kith and Kin. You will go to great lengths to see they are unharmed, even if they are the ones trying to harm you. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="History">History</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Religion">Religion</LSTag>.

You love a good puzzle. Constantly looking for and into the various machinations the world has to offer to see how they work. You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Insight">Insight</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Arcana">Arcana</LSTag>.
Your time spent in the underdark and dealing with their machinations has made you reistant to poison.
Having to spend a good amount of time hiding who you are and who you are working with has made you a natural at blending in with the scenery.
Life in the underdark was rough and you've learned to hide truths from everyone at an early age.
You've hand to stand up for what you believe time and time again. You have gained a strong will due to never backing down.
Eilistraean ritual to change a beings race and/or gender so they may experience life through their own eyes.

Ignite your hand with sacred moonfire, a cold silvery flame gifted by Eilistraee. While active, your hand glows with divine frost, enabling <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Moonfire_Hurl">Throw Moonfire</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Moonfire_Touch">Touch of Moonfire</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Moonfire_Dismiss">Extinguish Moonfire</LSTag>.
Hurl the moonfire from your hand in a flash of freezing light. On hit, the target takes [1] and [2] and is afflicted with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Moonfire_Technical">Dark Maiden's Mark</LSTag>.

Strike with your glowing hand, expelling the moonfire directly into a creature. On hit, it takes [1] and [2] and is afflicted with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Moonfire_Technical">Dark Maiden's Mark</LSTag>.
Extinguish the moonfire currently burning on your hand. Ends the Moonfire state without triggering any effects. Can be used freely to deactivate Eilistraee's Moonfire.
Creature becomes seared by Eilistraee's Moonfire for 3 turns and cannot become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag>.

Specialized clerics of the Dark Maiden were known as Sword Dancers. They were excellent dancers and spellsingers, known to use an agile and acrobatic fencing style resembling a dance. The sword dancers led missions to find, assist, and protect any drow looking to return to the surface (or that could be made to return) and embrace a different life. They were skilled diplomats, especially active near the settlements of elves and other races, working to establish peace and cooperation between drow and surface dwellers.

The Silverhair Knights were an order of clerics of Eilistraee completely dedicated to the redemption and subsequent protection of drow followers of Lolth, Vhaeraun, and other deities of the Dark Seldarine. They fully embraced the teaching of Eilistraee about showing mercy and compassion, and fought these dark elves only using non-lethal means, hoping to make them understand the error of their ways and choose a different life. Like the Sword Dancers, they often embarked on missions within Lolthite settlements, aiming to find and rescue drow who were in danger or seeking an alternative.

The Darksong Knights were an elite order of Eilistraeeans, mostly active in the South, beneath the lands of ancient Ilythiir. Each member of this order was a battle-priest who chose to devote their life not only to furthering the Dark Maiden's goals, but also to the destruction of yochlol and other demons and minions of Lolth, for they were the cause of the corruption and fall of the drow people.

The Protectors of the Song were the temple guards of the Promenade of the Dark Maiden, the main center of worship of Eilistraee on Faerûn. Their main duty was to protect the temple and patrol the area around the Pit of Ghaunadaur, to prevent the return of the slime god.

This spell can be cast while you are Silenced.

The bonus on hit damage starts at 0 and increases by [1] every 5 levels.

Summon a great sword of force that hovers within range. When the sword appears, The sword can make melee regular melee attacks and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SpellSong_MordenkainensSlash">Spell Song Mordenkainens Slash</LSTag> dealing [1]. Until the spell ends, the sword can move up to 30m from you and attack as if it was a Greatsword.
Make a melee spell attack against a target dealing [1].
Attack the target dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].
Cover more distance this turn: double your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag>.

This reaction won't trigger on a Critical Hit.

Cannot be stacked with Booming Blade.
Parry the next melee attack that hits you to reduce the damage by [1] + <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Ritually bind the weapon in your main hand. The weapon can't be knocked out of your hand, and it automatically returns to you when <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Throw_Throw">Thrown</LSTag>.

Ritually bound to its wielder.

The weapon can't be knocked out of the wielder's hand, and automatically returns to the wielder when Thrown.

Charges that can be accumulated for the Eilistraean Song Climax while Eilistraean Singing. Attacking with a weapon grants a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_CHARGE">Eilistraean Song Charge</LSTag>. In addition to gaining Eilistraean Song Slot Slots.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Rush_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

You also unlock your sub-class Maneuvers and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanSong_Finisher">Eilistraean Song Climax</LSTag> and the ability to accumulate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> in combat.

Attackers have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this creature, unless they do not rely on sight or can see through illusions.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

This reaction will trigger on a Critical Hit.

.
Attack an enemy moving out of your reach.

Eilistraean Song impeded by a weapon. Until the ranged weapon is removed and/or one of the required melee weapons equipped, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.

Eilistraean Song impeded by armour. Until the armour is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Whenever you successfully evade an attack, one of the duplicates disappears. Doesn't affect creatures that don't rely on sight or that can see through illusions.

Unleash the full damaging and healing effects of your Eilistraean Song at once. Your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_CHARGE">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag> will harm enemies an additional [1], and will heal you and your allies an additional [2].

If it is higher level than [1], you must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">check</LSTag> to prevent it. The check's difficulty is equal to [2] plus the level of the spell you are trying to counter.

<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISTRACTED">Distract</LSTag> your target, giving your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against the target.
Training in Eilistraean War and Song
Deal a bonus [1] to the target. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread green flames to burn another for [2].

Invoke the Eilistraean Blade Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> increases by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean Moon Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_UnarmedAttack">Unarmed Attack</LSTag> increases by [2]. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean War Rhythm. You gain a +[1] bonus to your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MainHandAttack">MainHand Attack</LSTag>. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Athletics and a +[2] bonus to Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. You are immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYSED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>.

Invoke the Eilistraean Spell Song. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Performance and a +[1] bonus to Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. You also gain a +[1] bonus to Wisdom and Charisma. You are immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYSED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can retaliate with a powerful strike that deals an additional [1] damage if you are wielding a melee weapon.
You learn Eilistraean Actions <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanHide">Eilistraean Hide</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_EilistraeanDash">Eilistraean Dash</LSTag>.
This will end your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag>.

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and possibly knocks the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and possibly force them to drop the weapons they are holding. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target dealing a bonus [1] and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISTRACTED">Distract</LSTag> your target, giving your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on their next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> against it. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Attack the target with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to [1] enemies at once dealing a bonus [2]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [3].

Charge forward and slam your weapon into the first enemy in your way dealing a bonus [1]. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].
When hit with a melee attack, the affected entity can use a reaction and reduce the damage by [1].
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> The target can't be Huge in size.
You can use both your action and bonus action on a turn to attack a target with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and deal an additional [1] damage.
The target must be Large or smaller.
When you take the Dash Action, your Speed increases by [1] for that action.

Attacks with weapons you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in and throwing attacks scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher. Excludes Heavy and Two-handed Weapons.
Throwing attacks scale with your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> instead of your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> if your Dexterity is higher.
Throw melee main hand to do [1] to target.
Throw melee off hand to do [1] to target.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, or Shortsword. You can not have any ranged weapon equipped.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Light or Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be Unarmed.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Light or Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, Shortsword or Greatsword.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear light, cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You must be wielding a Dagger, Longsword, Rapier, Scimitar, or Shortsword.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> You can only wear light, cloth or no armor while Eilistraean Song. All other Medium or Heavy Armour or Shields are not allowed
Equipped gear, melee weapon, ranged weapon, or shield is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipped melee weapon is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipping a ranged weapon is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.
Equipped armour is incompatible with Eilistraean Song.

Nullify another creature's spell as a reaction. The spell must be Level [1] or lower. If it is higher, you must succeed a <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> to nullify it, the difficulty of which is based on the spell's Level.
Can only use Moon Fire Blade once per action.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and the target within [1] but for both you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

Strike the target dealing a bonus [1] and deal extra damage to a foe you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> against. If the attack lands and you remain stationary, you can spread Moon Fire to burn another nearby creature for [2].

Invoking the Eilistraean Song. You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is increased by [2]m. You also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> in Acrobatics and a +[1] bonus to Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
You can make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly knocks the target <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Your hands have become infused with the weave and anticipate your movements. You gain an additional action.

Eilistraean Song impeded by a shield. Until the shield is removed, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Swing your weapon in a large arc to attack up to [1] enemies at once.
Make an attack that deals an additional [1] damage and possibly forces the target to drop the weapons they are holding.
Heal a creature you can see.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> No effect on undead and constructs.
If you move after making a melee attack, you don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag> from your target.
This effect still works if your attack misses.
You gain the ability to channel certain spells through song.
Can burn a nearby enemy with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MoonFireBladeExtra">Spread Moon Fire Blade</LSTag>. Removed if you move.
You gain an additional way to use your Sneak Attack; You can now also perform sneak attacks if there are no other enemies within [1] of the target (the enemy is isolated).
Reactions, such as <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>, are responses you can have to events. Reactions can trigger both during and outside of your turn.

Your confidence propels you into battle. You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>
Summon blades to sweep at creatures within [1] of you.
Hide from enemies by succeeding <LSTag Tooltip="Stealth">Stealth checks</LSTag>. Stick to the dark and avoid enemy sightlines. Attacking or casting a spell will reveal your location.
Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, A Cloud of Darkness is formed around you and you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

Surrounded by silver mist, you teleport to an unoccupied space [1] away you can see. Afterwards, A Cloud of Darkness is formed around you and all enemies take psychic damage. You also have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next melee <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.

A charge that will increase how much damage you deal to enemies by [1] and how much you heal yourself and your allies by [1] when using Eilistraean Song Climax.

You can accumulate these charges by attacking with weapons.
Use this resource to cast Spell Songs during combat

Create [1] illusory duplicates of yourself that distract attackers. Each duplicate increases your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> to [2]. Attackers have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against you.
You can't use this attack if you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.

You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with Light Armour and in the Performance skill. You also gain Proficiency with Daggers, Sickles, Shortswords, Rapiers, Scimitars, and Longswords.
The mirror image distracts attackers, increasing the spellcaster's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 3. When the caster successfully evades an attack, one of the images disappears.

Insult a creature: it has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on its next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>. Targets allies within [1] new to make a save or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> with laughter, without the ability to get up.
All the time spent practicing with blades, spells and sleight of hand has paid off. You gain an additional bonus and reaction action.
Cannot be targeted by <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MoonFireBladeExtra">Spread Moon Fire Blade</LSTag>.
During Eilistraean Song, Cleave your weapon in a rapid, sweeping arc to attack multiple enemies at once.

Eilistraean Song impeded due to being unarmed. Until a valid weapon is equipped, your <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EILISTRAEAN_SONG">Eilistraean Song</LSTag> won't grant any benefits or let you generate <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SONG_TECHINCAL">Eilistraean Song Charges</LSTag>.
Also works if you have an ally within [1] of the target or there is no one but you and within [1] of the target. However you can't have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Can only cast Blade Extra Attack once per action.
You conjure [2] shards of concentrated moonlight and send them streaking toward targets within range. Each shard always hits and deals [1].
You touch a creature and stimulate its natural healing ability. The target regains [1] + [3]. For the duration of the spell, the target regains [2] at the start of each of its turns.

You channel the fury of Eilistraee on Fiends, weakening their very essence. Magic that would normally bounce off its form now burns its flesh. All Darksong spells and attacks will ignore any <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> the target has to all damage types.

You channel the fury of Eilistraee on Oozes, weakening their very essence. Magic that would normally bounce off its form now burns its flesh. All Darksong spells and attacks will ignore any <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> the target has to all damage types.
Wrap yourself in silvery moonlight and vanish, reappearing in an unoccupied space within 18m.
Remove Curses and Hexes on up to [1] Creatures or Objects afflicted by them within 6m.
Creature is engulfed by Eilistraee's Moonlight that deal [1] and [2] per turn. On a successful save, the creature still takes half damage.

Perform an inspiring melody that affects up to [1] of creatures within 10m who can hear you. Affected allies gain advantage on saving throws against being Charmed or Frightened, a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> equal to your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, and a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. Lasts for 10 turns while you maintain concentration.

You conjure strands of moonlight in the form of elven spirits that embrace and heal your allies. Choose up to 6 creatures within 10m who can hear you, each target is healed for [1] plus your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. The healing increases by 1d6 for each spell slot level above 4th.
Move Eilistraee's Moonlight up to [1]. The Moonlight damages any creature [2] and [3] that enters it or starts its turn inside.
Protect up to [1] targets, they cannot be targeted until attacking or harming another creature but can still take damage from area spells.
Fire a bolt of concentrated moonlight at a target, dealing [1] and [2] and leaving a frozen surface at the point of impact.
Protect up to [1] creatures from death. The next time damage would reduce them to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, they remain conscious with 1 hit point left.
Eilistraee's Moonlight engulfs any creature that enters this silvery light or starts its turn inside it. They take [1] and [2]. On a successful save, targets still take half damage.
Strike your foe with Eilistraee's divine power, channeling both the radiant brilliance and frigid grace of the moon dealing [1] and [2]. The [3] increases by [4] when attacking Fiends or Undead.

You perform a haunting melody that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED ">Charms</LSTag> nearby foes and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INCAPACITATED ">Incapacitates</LSTag> all creatures within 10m who fail a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, including those who enter the area later. Affected targets cannot be charmed again by this spell more than once, you cannot take actions while performing and moving will break concentration.

Empower yourself with the grace of the Dark Maiden, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next weapon attack, it deals an additional [1] and [2] on a hit and you do not provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 9m until the end of that turn.
Cure up to [1] creatures from disease, poison, paralysis or blindness within 9m.

You become so attuned to Eilistraee's own dance and song, that all your movements are cloaked in unearthly grace. You ignore effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Terrain</LSTag>, have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> and if a spell or effect would deal half damage on a successful Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, it deals no damage if you succeed, and only half damage if you fail.

You teleport between up to 5 enemies within range, dancing through them in a flurry of strikes. Each hit channels Eilistraee's will, dealing [1] and [2] and you reappear beside the final target, your form trailing glimmers of moonlight.

Six multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each creature in a 18m cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d6 to determine the effect.

On roll of 1: [1], on 2: [2], on 3: [3], on 4: [4], on 5: [5] and half as much on a failed save. On a 6 and a failed save, the target is Blinded. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is Banished for 4 turns.

Conjure a 4m radius circle of silvery moonlight that lasts for 3 turns. Allies inside restore [1] each turn, gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic and Psychic damage. Targets cannot become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> and Invisibility is removed while inside.
Your attacks are suffused with Eilistraee's Divine Moonlight dealing an additional [1] and [2].

Purifying energy radiates from you in an aura with a 9m radius. You and allies are <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to Disease, <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag>, gain an <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and against <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyzed</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poisoned</LSTag> status effects.
Protect a creature from death. The next time damage would reduce it to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>, it remains conscious with 1 hit point left.

You and any nearby allies within 3m can see through magical and non-magical darkness, and cannot be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>. In addition, gain a bonus to Insight and Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> based on your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.
You call down a pillar of moonlit grace infused with the divine presence of the Dark Maiden. All creatures within the area take [2] and [3]. You can use an action to move it [1].
You conjure [2] shards of concentrated moonlight and send them streaking toward targets within range. Each shard always hits and deals [1].
Wrap yourself in silvery moonlight and vanish, reappearing in an unoccupied space within 18m.
Move Eilistraee's Moonlight up to [1]. The Moonlight damages any creature [2] and [3] that enters it or starts its turn inside.
Fire a bolt of concentrated moonlight at a target, dealing [1] and [2] and leaving a frozen surface at the point of impact.

Empower yourself with the grace of the Dark Maiden, you gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next weapon attack, it deals an additional [1] and [2] on a hit and you do not provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>. Whether you hit or miss, your walking speed increases by 9m until the end of that turn.

Six multicolored rays of light flash from your hand. Each creature in a 18m cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a d6 to determine the effect.

On roll of 1: [1], on 2: [2], on 3: [3], on 4: [4], on 5: [5] and half as much on a failed save. On a 6 and a failed save, the target is Blinded. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is Banished for 4 turns.

Conjure a 4m radius circle of silvery moonlight that lasts for 3 turns. Allies inside restore [1] each turn, gain <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic and Psychic damage. Targets cannot become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> and Invisibility is removed while inside.
You call down a pillar of moonlit grace infused with the divine presence of the Dark Maiden. All creatures within the area take [2] and [3]. You can use an action to move it [1].

Creatures within this black sphere are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>,<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HIDEOUS_LAUGHTER">Hideous Laughter</LSTag> and take damage at the start of their turn.

Creatures starting their turn in the area need to make a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take [1] and be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> and succumb to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HIDEOUS_LAUGHTER">Hideous Laughter</LSTag>. On a successful save, they only take 1/2 damage and suffer no status aliments.
Heal each Ally that is not Undead or a Construct for 700 hp withing 30m and remove Poison, Disease, Paralysed, Blinded, Silence and Color Spray effects from them. Also removes the Astarion debuff.
You become immune to all damage and all status effects.

Brilliant Moonlight flashes in a 20m radius centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in that light must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [1] radiant and [1] cold damage and is blinded for 10 turns. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn'st blinded by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.
Allies in the Aura receive advantage on al ability checks. Enemies in the Aura recieve Disadvantage on Attack Rolls and take [1] damage.
Target anything not a Plant and make it an ally regardless of level or type.

Enemies within 30m who fail their save with less than 20 HP are instantly killed, those with 30 or less HP are blinded and stunned, those with 40 or less are Blinded. Any fiend, demon, celestial or elemental is banished for 10 turns.

Seven star-like motes of light appear and orbit your head until the spell ends. You can use a bonus action to send one of the motes streaking toward one creature or object within 30m feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes [1] radiant damage. Whether you hit or miss, the mote is expended. The spell ends early if you expend the last mote. If you have four or more motes remaining, they shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.
Use a bonus action to send a shard at an enemy causing [1] damage.

You can use a bonus action to send one of the motes streaking toward one creature or object within 30m feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes [1] radiant damage.
You can now mete out a flurry of comfort and hurt. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can spend 1 Ki to an additional [1] + [2] of damage and you can spend another 1 Ki to regain [3] + [4] hit points.
You can heal target for [1] + [2] hit points.
You can harm a target for [1] + [2] hit points.
You can now mete out a flurry of comfort and hurt. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can spend 1 Ki to regain [1] + [2] hit points.
You can now mete out a flurry of comfort and hurt. When you use Flurry of Blows, you can spend 1 Ki to an additional [1] + [2] of damage.

You gain the ability to set up lethal vibrations in someone's body. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to start these imperceptible vibrations. The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them. When you use this action, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds, it takes 10d10 necrotic damage. You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can choose to end the vibrations harmlessly without using an action.
Active Quivering Palm on target making them make a Constitution saving throw or die, on a save target takes 10d10 necrotic damage.
Dismiss Quivering Palm without any adverse effect on target.
As long as you don't miss, you can continue to make unarmed attacks this turn.
Attacks with <LSTag Tooltip="MonkWeapon">Monk Weapons</LSTag> and unarmed attacks deal [1], unless their normal damage is higher.
While equipped this weapon gives the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Bless</LSTag>
While equipped this weapon gives the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HASTE">Haste</LSTag>
While equipped this weapon gives the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FREEDOM_OF_MOVEMENT">Freedom of Movement</LSTag>
While equipped this weapon gives the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GUIDANCE">Guidance</LSTag>
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Constitution save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="LIGHT">Light</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Constitution save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SILENCED">Silenced</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Constitution save vs. [1] or be pushed backed 8m.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Constitution save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Constitution save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyzed</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Dexterity save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED">Ensnared</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Dexterity save vs. [1] or die.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Strength save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Ensnared in vines</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Wisdom save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Wisdom save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MADNESS">Madness</LSTag>.
On a successful hit, enemy must make a Wisdom save vs. [1] or gain the status <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charmed</LSTag>.

Sheds holy light in a [1] radius. In combat, enemies standing in the light are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag>, unless they succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.

Sheds holy light in a [1] radius. In combat, enemies standing in the light are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="IRRESISTIBLE_DANCE">Irresistible Dance</LSTag>, unless they succeed a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
On a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag>, the target takes an extra [1]. You also regain [2].
When ever you make a kill with this blade regain one Song Charge.
You are immune to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> and game <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDSIGHT">Blind sight</LSTag>.
When you have both Darklight blades equipped, successful attacks surround the target in Darkness and you gain advantage on attack rolls.
You gain advantage on attack rolls and your weapon does [1] extra damage.
You gain advantage on stealth checks and your weapon does [1] extra damage.

When you have Z'resslin "Strengthling" and Veldrineth "Little Shadow" both equipped, you gain 3 bonus movement and if you hit an enemy they becoem <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightened</LSTag>
Enemies have disadvantage to attack you and damage done by melee sources is reduced by 10.
Your weapon's critical hit thresold is reduced by [1]
Gain advantage on all <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>
You perform and your allies dance in the moonlight. You both gain [1] or [2] HP for each turn you continue to dance.

The Daarra, more commonly known as spellbones, are a trademark magic item crafted in the Eilistraean city of Imberlur. Daarra are 5-6 inches long batons of grey-white porcelain and imbued with the power of a single spell. Breaking a spellbone releases the imbued spell under the control of the breaker, regardless to their skill in, or aptitude for, magic.
Daarra of Smile Of The Dark Lady
Daarra of Protection From Evil And Good
Forged for sacred rites beneath silver moons, it sings only in the hands of the faithful.
A blade that finds the rhythm of battle as effortlessly as a dancer follows the beat.
Quick as a heartbeat, graceful as a waltz - each strike lands in perfect tempo.
Its edge glimmers with the cold hunger of the moon; beautiful, merciless.
Spinning in dusk’s embrace, this blade leaves trails of starlight in its wake.
Not all strikes roar; some whisper - soft as moonlight, just as deadly.
The song at dusk becomes a weapon - a melodic promise of peace, or the end.
Swift and silent, it grants release with a final, forgiving step.
Born from guilt and grace, it redeems the fallen with every pierce of silver light.
This slender blade glides through shadow like a dancer slipping between curtains.
Soft as a lover’s touch, lethal as betrayal - elegance woven with death.
Each arc is a step of battle’s ballet; strength expressed in beautiful motion.
No clashing steel, no screams - only the hush of the void left behind.
It kisses the skin like shadowfall - gentle, then gone, leaving only the wound.
A hidden pain from within, this dagger carries old grudges and deeper truths.
Unpredictable and graceful, it dances like candlelight before the storm.
Woven with threads of divine light, it snags fate itself with each swing.
Precise and piercing, it sews dusk and dawn together with threads of pain.
No glamour or illusion withstands its gaze - it cuts through lies as through flesh.
The blade hums with a haunting melody that only the doomed can truly hear.
Each flash of its edge is a lesson - gleaming judgment from a graceful hand.
Forged from betrayal, it weeps not for its victims, but for what they might have been.
Its deadly curves inspire awe before fear; beauty that cuts deeper than steel.
Bound to tradition, it gleams in honor - a duelist’s promise etched in silver.
At the boundary between moonlight and shadow, this blade shines with serene resolve.
A scholar’s sword, meant not to conquer, but to reveal the truth within conflict.
Two blades, one purpose - to sing in harmony with the goddess’s will.
It will not rest while her enemies draw breath; every strike a prayer in motion.
It arcs with the grace of a tempest dancer, each motion catching wind and fate alike.
Seen only in the corner of your eye - by the time you notice, it’s too late.
A rhythm born in shadows, this blade strikes to a beat only its wielder hears.
Flowing, fluid, and relentless - the embodiment of Eilistraee’s eternal dance.
Its light is faint, but focused - a shard of the moon caught in a mortal’s hand.
Balanced in form and intent, it brings peace through perfect, deliberate violence.
Silent and swift, it cuts like a breeze through silk - unnoticed until the end.
Curved and ever-moving, it dances like water caught in lunar tide.
Wielded with grace, it turns war into art and combat into choreography.
A noble relic, radiant with matriarchal power and divine reverence.
It shines not in obedience but defiance - a beacon against oppressive dark.
To wield it is to answer - to dance, to sing, to fight for a brighter night.
Balanced and pure, it sings with each strike - a hymn to peace.
A single note from this blade echoes into eternity.
Each movement begins a wave, subtle but unstoppable.
In the heart of battle, it blossoms with radiant power.
Its passage is felt, not heard - death in perfect poise.
A cadence of steel, keeping time with the beat of battle.
Fast and small, yet guided by divine grace.
A final lullaby for the fallen, sung in steel and sorrow.
A blade that never falters, its movements a dance of mercy.
Forged in hope, they strike as one - swift and sure.
Born of redemption, it carries the hopes of a changing people.
It watches with intent, and strikes with purpose.
Loyal and silent, its velvet bite is swift and sure.
A sister’s love forged into steel, delicate and fierce.
Its glow is faint, but never fades - a hidden strength.
Every thread sings; each movement is a story woven in war.
Formed in celestial fire, it tempers wrath with compassion.
Where light and shadow meet, it reigns in twilight sovereignty.
Forgiveness in form - a blade that restores as it protects.
A flicker of light in endless dark, guiding the lost to safety.
It bears the promise of dawn, sworn under shimmering skies.
In its presence, fear fades - a quiet refuge amid chaos.
It moves in harmony with truth, each strike revealing the real.
A defiant blade turned away from cruelty, wielded in purpose.
Each strike is music, sacred and savage.
Soft as silk, but in motion, it becomes lethal beauty.
Strength and elegance are one - this blade proves it.
It sings of ancient truths, holy and terrible.
Calm and unwavering, it delivers justice with a still heart.
It weeps for the night, and ends those who taint it.
To fall under its arc is to be held by moonlight... and end.
It shines brightest in despair, leading the way home.
Splits shadow from soul, revealing what lies beneath.
Her blessing made blade, extended to shield the innocent.
Crowned in moonlight, it leads the battle’s final waltz.
The dance ends in fury, and none are spared her final note.
Sacred, serene, and merciless - the final severance of evil.
Faer Oloth’ilhar "Magic of the Shadow Matron"
Mystic and maternal, it guides shadow with divine clarity.
It burns with pride and purpose, for those who walk the light.
A daughter of moonlight, her blade protects the innocent night.
Sharp as thought, fluid as faith - wielded with reverent grace.
It watches over all, and strikes when justice is denied.
Barely heard, but deeply felt - each swing a secret revealed.
A hush on the battlefield, broken only by breath and blood.
Refined elegance, reborn from shadow into sacred duty.
A glimmer in the gloom, as sudden as it is final.
A playful kiss of dusk - light, teasing, and fatal.
Two blades, one song - a harmony only battle can play.
Every motion is a verse, every strike a stanza.
An ancient spell given form - it protects the people with poetry.
Perfectly curved, it arcs with divine rhythm.
Its melody enthralls, even as it ends the dance.
Magic in constant motion, a lyrical blur of destruction.
Soft as a lover’s sigh, deadly as the dusk.
Each strike reverberates, calling back the will of the goddess.
A dance in death, graceful and unstoppable.
Born to end a tyrant’s reign - each cut defies her venom.
A divine fury tempered by light - holy justice made blade.
It swears loyalty under the stars and never breaks its word.
It drifts between hands, always drawn to those who hope.
Spellsong and swordplay united in radiant devotion.
Its edge reveals hidden truths cloaked in darkness.
It shreds illusions and deceptions alike - no veil survives.
Brighter than fire, wilder than wind - it cannot be caged.
Rrinnoroth of the Crescent "Crescent Blade of Justice"
Justice arcs wide and true - a blade shaped by faith.
Tlu Bel'lae Eilistraee "To Be Beautiful Is to Follow Eilistraee"
To wield it is to honor beauty, mercy, and the moonlit path.
Bestowed in the final moments before death, this blade carries the sorrow of parting. It delivers its touch with the softness of a farewell and the finality of an oath.
This sacred dagger hums with barely audible prayers. Its wielder speaks not with words, but with the divine will of the Dark Maiden carried in every strike.
Both punishment and forgiveness flow from its edge. The matron who wields it offers peace through steel, tempered by duty and devotion.
Forged where music meets magic, this blade harmonizes with its wielder’s spellcraft. Each swing echoes with a chord of power that resonates deep into the soul.
Faster than the eye, this blade spins like a dancer in full flight. It needs no flourish - only motion, rhythm, and lethal precision.
A remnant of Eilistraee’s first song lingers within this sword. It answers her call in battle, echoing her sorrow, love, and fierce protection.
This blade was given to those who vowed to protect the sacred groves of Eilistraee. It gleams with quiet conviction and never fails those who walk her moonlit path.
Arcing like moonlight over still waters, its motion is a sacred dance. Each strike is as graceful as it is devastating, honoring the rhythm of battle.
Elegant in its lethality, it flows with the perfect grace of practiced art. Wielders of this blade fight as if performing before the goddess herself.
One half of a paired set, this blade flickers between light and shadow. When united with its twin, they create a perfect balance of brilliance and gloom.
Crafted alongside its sibling, it mirrors the moon's dual nature - luminous above, secretive below. Wielded together, they strike as one soul in two forms.
Said to be wielded in the final battle of a fallen priestess, this blade remembers her last steps. It now moves with the memory of defiance, sorrow, and sublime beauty.
A divine lament forged into steel, it mourns every lost soul who strayed from the light. Each strike carries both the sorrow and forgiveness of Eilistraee herself.
This blade was made in the vision of unity, not conquest. It empowers those who wield it with righteous purpose, whether elf, drow, or otherwise.
Vhaer tlu Sarn "Truth Shall Be Moonlight"
Inscribed with ancient vows, its edge reflects the truth in every lie. Those who carry it are bound to justice, even when it comes cloaked in shadow.

Shed in divine sorrow during the banishment of the drow, this crystalline blade holds the compassion of a goddess. Its radiant edge heals as it cuts, mending broken souls even as it defends the innocent. Those who wield it are blessed with visions of Eilistraee’s path. To strike with it is to weep for what could have been, and fight for what still can be.

Forged in the heart of a moonlit grove, this blade dances of its own accord, guiding even the untrained in the goddess's sacred rhythm. In battle, it arcs with luminous grace, leaving stardust in its wake. Its motion is mesmerizing, almost hypnotic, as if the moon itself were wielding it. Only those who hear the music of the night can truly master its steps.

Though small and unassuming, this blade holds the strength of ten champions. It was forged for the frail and overlooked, granting them the might to challenge tyrants. Each strike roars with latent power, turning vulnerability into righteous fury. It reminds all who see it that strength is not size, but spirit.

Born in deepest darkness, this blade slips between worlds like a whisper. It is silent, unseen, and ever vigilant - the perfect companion to those who walk the twilight path. Its shadowy edge leaves no wound upon flesh, only on the soul. Legends say it can pass through walls, dreams, and even regrets.

Infused with Eilistraee’s divine moonlight and Mystra’s arcane weave, this weapon bridges the divine and the arcane. It sings with pure resonance when wielded in defense of the weak. Each swing unleashes spiraling glyphs of light, weaving protective magic and destructive force in equal measure. Only those who honor both goddess and spell may hold its hilt without burning.

An ancient relic, this blade once guarded the gates of the Promenade itself. It hums with reverence and memory, protecting not just a place, but a sacred ideal. When unsheathed, its glow draws courage from those nearby and fear from those who have lost their way. To bear it is to become a living prayer in steel.
Inscribed with sigils of the goddess, it channels divine energy through motion.
Embroidered with spells of old, it shields the wearer from unseen danger.
Soft and unassuming, it cradles the body in gentle warmth and subtle enchantment.
Though simple in form, it holds protective magics woven into every thread.
Every movement in this garment reflects an ancient truth, etched into its fibers by celestial hands.
Infused with clarity, it shields the mind as well as the body in moments of divine revelation.
A robe of silent vigilance, it grants the wearer insight as sharp as the moon is bright.
Laced with threads of wisdom, it grants quiet understanding and inner strength.
Wearing this grants the aura of a moon eclipsed - quiet, majestic, and dangerous.
This coat hums with latent enchantment, perfect for those who guard with magic and grace.
Wrapped in this weave, the wearer becomes both observer and instrument of divine rhythm.
Draped in sacred intent, this mantle binds the wearer to the arcane song of the goddess.
A matron’s pride spun into form, this robe radiates command and reverence alike.
Adorned with sigils of elegance, it transforms each motion into an expression of beauty.
Its shadowed folds conceal a brilliance that bursts forth when wielded in justice.
Sanctified in moonlight, it bears blessings in every stitch and fold.
A ward against spiritual darkness, it shields with grace as well as power.
Shell-like in structure, it shields the soul as well as the skin from corruption.
With every movement, it shimmers like sunlight over polished stone.
Elegance perfected - each thread imbued with the intent to awe and endure.
Soft as silk, strong as resolve, it guards without ever resisting the dancer’s flow.
Skinned from illusions and shadows, it grants refuge to the worthy.
A radiant shell against intrusion, strengthened by moon-blessed sigils.
It vibrates gently with divine resonance, bringing peace to allies and dread to foes.
Its dark hue hides sacred purpose - guardianship draped in mystery.
Robes such as this are gifted only to those who embody grace and song.
Woven from strands of moonlight and arcane thread, this robe resonates with divine energy.
Moonlit glyphs woven into the hem shimmer only when danger nears.
Each step in this vestment trails mist, as though the wind dances with the wearer.
Blending arcane power and serenity, its harmony flows through every hem and fold.
A robe that pulses with silver light, protecting and empowering the heart beneath it.
Its swirling design mimics a dancer’s flourish - beautiful, swift, and fatal when provoked.
Whispers seem to rise from the fabric, shielding the wearer with unseen song.
The stitching forms subtle glyphs meant to turn away malevolent magic.
Crafted for stealth and serenity, it muffles movement and absorbs tension.
Enchanted with arcane wards, this shell cushions both body and spirit against intrusion.
Its light form hugs the body like a breeze, shielding its wearer without sound or drag.
Woven with sun-touched thread, it grants calm clarity in moments of chaos.
Bound in runes of concealment, it mutes footsteps and masks heartbeats.
This armor glows faintly with the strength of deep shadow - a guardian’s mantle of resolve.
Etched with truths both spoken and hidden, it bolsters magic with each breath drawn.
Moonlight dwells in its core, diffusing warmth and serenity through every motion.
The soft sheen of its surface belies the strength interlaced within its layered weave.
It breathes like skin, whispering promises of protection in times of silence.
A faint shimmer trails its edges, like dew clinging to morning light.
Crafted for defense through dignity, this armor folds around the wearer like second skin.
Pillowed for silence, it offers comfort even in the thick of night.
Elegant yet unassuming, this armor carries a matron’s quiet grace into every step.
Soft but sacred, this armor hums with quiet prayers woven between layers.
With every fold stitched in reverence, it radiates confidence born of legacy and strength.
Layered with radiant sigils, its form deflects harm through gentle repulsion.
This weave sparkles softly under divine light, calming both heart and foe alike.
Etched with holy sigils, its hide pulses faintly with moonlit energy.
Worn by duskblades and guardians of the Promenade alike.
This blade-forged armor bears the marks of ancient power, granting swift lethality in silent form.
Light as wind, it shifts around the body like a storm on the cusp of movement.
Every stitch holds a blessing, radiating warmth and divine intention to its bearer.
The supple surface absorbs light, allowing the wearer to vanish between heartbeats.
Woven from silken threads and reinforced with intent, it grants beauty without sacrificing defense.
A fusion of intellect and elegance, this armor invites calm precision with every breath.
Anointed in darkness, this armor offers vigilance and unyielding resolve beneath its folds.
Forged from the darkest steel and finest hide, this second skin moves with lethal elegance.
Gossamer to the touch, it bends around the wearer like flowing water and layered mist.
Harvested from lunar-touched beasts, its pale hide grants comfort and uncanny resilience.
Wrapped tight for travel and combat alike, its fabric breathes with the breath of wild winds.
Threaded with veiled glyphs, this weave binds shadow and moonlight into seamless motion.
Silent in the dark, it offers flexibility to those who strike like shadow.
Draped in shadowed folds, it blends perfectly into night and memory alike.
Soaked in silver light, this armor pulses with moon-born resilience and grace.
The silver sheen dazzles in low light, distracting foes just long enough for a deadly response.
Tempered from sacred beasts and blessed by priestesses of the moon.
Sharp in line and fluid in fit, it responds to motion with an almost musical rhythm.
A hybrid of form and function, sacred and savage alike.
Each stud is a blessing, hammered in place under moonrise.
Light and reinforced, it protects while enabling the rhythm of motion.
Bound with enchantments of concealment, this armor conceals the wearer in layers of shadowed grace.
Each step in this garb is hushed, as if the armor itself guards its bearer’s secrets.
Embodying the strength of a thousand matriarchs, this sacred leather grants unmatched authority.
Built in ancient forges, its dark studs gleam with the light of purpose long hidden beneath the earth.
Infused with insight, it grants the wearer not only defense, but clarity in times of doubt.
Its radiant studs pulse with protective energy, shielding the faithful from harm and hesitation.
This armor holds the warmth of a guiding hand, offering security in the fluidity of motion.
Woven in secrecy, the studs conceal sacred patterns only visible to those attuned to shadow.
Soft as breath and silent as silk, this shroud turns the wearer into a whisper of vengeance.
Tailored for movement and expression, it protects without hindering the flow of dance or battle.
Runes of moon-song magic pulse from each plate, anchoring enchantments of resilience and swiftness.
The leather shifts like liquid shadow, studded with divine intent.
Glory clings to each reinforced plate, a matron’s pride sealed into form and function.
Studs etched with holy sigils enhance the divine energy woven into every seam of this armor.
Blessed under a full moon, this armor protects with a mother’s care and a warrior’s poise.
This chainmail flows like water, offering unmatched agility and silent defense.
Forged in silence beneath the surface, this armor grants its wearer an unseen gaze and vigilant strength.

Shadows cling to its edges like silk, veiling the bearer in quiet reverence and subtle power.

Its shimmer shifts like lies revealed - darkness pierced by unwavering light.
Moonlight ripples over this armor in rhythmic pulses, echoing the heartbeat of battle.
Refined for the twilight hour, its shine remains unseen until it is far too late.

Charged with arcane power, these gloves enhance strikes with a flash of magical force.

A cloak that flows like a quiet eclipse, shielding its wearer in tranquil stillness.
Silken threads carry soft whispers, wrapping the wearer in concealed beauty.

Carved from pale driftwood, this lyre’s song is as soft and intricate as a dancer’s steps.

Respec any character using this potion.
Ssussun'sabel dosst, abbil; mzild vel'sklar kyorl wun belbau.
I am Vel'suss Iltaress Xal Zhal, a low-born of no house, born of no one.
When I was young, a man took me away to work for him. Always hiding, always sneaking and always killing.
I was finally ready to leave that entire life behind and make my way back to the surface when the Illithid came.
I want to walk on the Surface and find my place among them.
You see a distressed Drow Elf Female.
Come here traitor, Minthara wants a word with you.
Fine then, The hard way it is!
Good to sees you got the sense about ya.
Your recent actions are questioning whether I want us to still be an US.
If you are going to continue with this behavior, I don't know if we can remain friends.
I thought you were better than this?
Our relationship was based on mutual respect, and you have lost mine.
I don't like the path you've been following because I can not walk down it.
If you continue on like this, you will do so alone.
If this is the path you walk, then my time beside you must end.
There can not be a US when you only think of the ME.
We used to walk in-line together, but now you fall to disarray.
I hardly knew you, now you will just fade into memory.
I know we've had our problems but this can't be the end?
You are the one who still can't see out of the dark.
Ok, well it's been interesting while it lasted.
I have suffered one parasite; I can no longer suffer the other.
You are nothing more than a child stuck in the Bibberbangs. One way or another, you will leave the Underdark.
May the rocks bite your ankles and chew on your feet.
